param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (table.moduletable), this allows individual module styling

param.name: cd_latestnews_html_content_width
param.label: Box width
param.description: Width of HTML content box - (px, em, % ...)

param.name: cache
param.label: Enable Cache
param.description: Select whether to cache the content of this module

param.name: type
param.label: Module Mode
param.description: Allows you to control which type of Content to display in the module

param.name: show_front
param.label: Frontpage Items
param.description: Show/Hide items designated for the Frontpage - only works when in Content Items only mode

param.name: count
param.label: Count
param.description: The number of items to display (default 5)

param.name: catid
param.label: Category ID
param.description: Selects items from a specific Category or set of Categories (to specify more than one Category, seperate with a comma , ).

param.name: secid
param.label: Section ID
param.description: Selects items from a specific Secion or set of Sections (to specify more than one Section, seperate with a comma , ).

param.name: cd_latestnews_titlelimit
param.label: Title limit
param.description: Characters limit for title. Set zero (0) to disable.

param.name: outlineType
param.label: Rounded
param.description: Official reference: The outline type refers to PNG graphics within the outlines directory. These graphic outlines appear outside the CSS border after the image is fully expanded.

param.name: anchor
param.label: Anchor
param.description: Official reference: The default setting is 'auto', which means the image tries to expand equally in all directions, but moves and/or contracts if it exceeds the client area.

param.name: align
param.label: Align
param.description: Official reference: Position of the full image in the client.

param.name: dimmingOpacity
param.label: Dimming Opacity
param.description: Official reference: The dimmingOpacity property creates the popular Lightbox darkening/lightening background effect. Setting dimmingOpacity to 0 disables the effect.
